page.title: 22THE WOODSIDE SHOPPING CENTRE
page.content:
The supermarket (P&A) was knocked down after standing empty for many years, you can still see its footprint. The public house (the Century) was recently knocked down and for a while you could see fields through the gap. A large Aldi was built on the site. The area with raised flower beds and seating was recently replaced with a large carpark and the underpass was filled in. There was an official regeneration.

The newsagents expanded and is more of a supermarket now, with a small post office inside. There is no butchers, green grocers or health centre.

There is a chemists, tool hire centre, hairdressers and the original community centre.
